title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch Indonesian communications satellite from Cape Canaveral
summary: The Nusantara Lima satellite is designed to augment communications in the region alongside Indonesia’s Satria satellite, which launched in June 2023. SpaceX is targeting liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Base at 8:02 p.m. EDT (0002 UTC).
detailed_news: SpaceX is targeting the liftoff of the N5 satellite from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral on Wednesday. The spacecraft comes from Satelit Nusantara Lima (SNL), a subsidiary of Indonesia’s first private satellite company. The satellite is built on the same Boeing-built bus used on Intelsat's IS-33e spacecraft, which suffered an anomaly in 2024. A computer-triggered abort halted the countdown of a Falcon 9 rocket Sunday at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. The next mission in SpaceX's launch surge until at least Monday. The launch was visible across Southern California and as far away as Arizona as the booster climbed into sunlight at dusk.

title: NASA Astronaut Frank Rubio in Space Station Cupola
summary: NASA astronaut Frank Rubio poses for a picture in the International Space Station’s cupola on Oct. 1, 2022. Rubio was selected as a NASA astronaut in 2017. He trained as a flight engineer and member of the Expedition 68 crew. Rubio, along with cosmonauts Sergey Prokopyev and Dmitry Petelin of Roscosmos, launched Sept. 21, 2022, […]
detailed_news: Frank Rubio was selected as a NASA astronaut in 2017. Rubio, along with cosmonauts Sergey Prokopyev and Dmitry Petelin of Roscosmos, launched Sept. 21, 2022, on the Soyuz MS-22 spacecraft from the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan to the space station. Rubio and his crewmates landed in Kazakhstan on Sept. 27, 2023.

title: Congress and Trump may compromise on the SLS rocket by axing its costly upper stage
summary: "At $4 billion a launch, you don’t have a Moon program."
detailed_news: NASA's Artemis Program and the future of the Space Launch System rocket are in the spotlight. The second Trump administration has sought to cancel the costly, expendable rocket. The solution involves canceling part of the SLS rocket now, but not all of it. The House Appropriations Committee will take up the Commerce, Justice, and Science budget bill on Wednesday morning. The House Appropriations Bill calls for NASA to "evaluate alternatives" to the Exploration Upper Stage. One of these is the Centaur V upper stage built by United Launch Alliance. Another option is a "short" version of the upper stage Blue Origin currently flies on its New Glenn rocket.

title: Starship Soars Back with Flight 10
summary: SpaceX’s Starship-Super Heavy launch vehicle completed its tenth flight test on Tuesday, August 26, 2025, marking this milestone with a resoundingly successful mission.
detailed_news: SpaceX’s Starship-Super Heavy launch vehicle completed its tenth flight test on Tuesday, August 26, 2025. Flight 10 breaks a streak of bad luck with the Block 2 or “V2” Starship design, which suffered three failures in a row on flights 7, 8, and 9. After ten all-up flights and more than two years, Starship has at last achieved all of the major objectives SpaceX sought to achieve. SpaceX aims to build and test the first V3 ships this year, though they may not fly until 2026. Meanwhile, Starship is still bound to its commitments to NASA and the Artemis program. Just over two years remain until Artemis III’s current public target of September 2027.

title: NASA Webb Looks at Earth-Sized, Habitable-Zone Exoplanet TRAPPIST-1 e
summary: Scientists are in the midst of observing the exoplanet TRAPPIST-1 e with NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope. Careful analysis of the results so far presents several potential scenarios for what the planet’s atmosphere and surface may be like, as NASA science missions lay key groundwork to answer the question, “are we alone in the universe?”  […]
detailed_news: Scientists are in the midst of observing the exoplanet TRAPPIST-1 e with NASA's James Webb Space Telescope. Careful analysis of the results so far presents several potential scenarios for what the planet’s atmosphere and surface may be like. NASA science missions lay key groundwork to answer the question “are we alone in the universe?” After previous Webb observations of planet b, scientists are fairly confident it is a bare rock without an atmosphere. The scientists are timing the observations so that Webb catches both planets b and e transiting the star one right after the other. Scientists plan to compare the data from both planets, and any indications of chemicals that show up only in planet e’s spectrum can be attributed to its atmosphere.

title: NASA Launches 2026 Lunabotics Challenge
summary: As college students across the country embark upon the academic year, NASA is giving them something else to look forward to – the agency’s 2026 Lunabotics Challenge. Teams interested in participating can submit their applications and supporting materials through NASA’s Stem Gateway portal beginning Monday, Sept. 8. Key dates and challenge details are available in […]
detailed_news: NASA is inviting teams to submit applications for its 2026 Lunabotics Challenge. Teams will create robots capable of building berms out of lunar regolith. Regolith will be important for blast protection during lunar landings and launches. The team scoring the most points will receive the Lunabotic Grand Prize.

title: Jeni Morrison Continues a Family Legacy of Service at NASA
summary: A child of the Space Shuttle Program, Jeni Morrison grew up walking the grounds of NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston with her parents and listening to family stories about human spaceflight.  Now, with more than 15 years at NASA, Morrison serves as one of Johnson’s Environmental Programs managers. She ensures the center complies with […]
detailed_news: Jeni Morrison is one of Johnson Space Center's Environmental Programs managers. She oversees regulatory compliance for cultural and natural resources, stormwater and drinking water programs. She also safeguards Johnson’s historic legacy as Johnson's Cultural Resources manager. Her message to the Artemis Generation is simple: Always keep learning!

title: Data from NASA’s Dawn reveals chemical energy source on Ceres
summary:
Using data from NASA’s now-retired Dawn spacecraft, scientists have found that Ceres, a dwarf planet…
The post Data from NASA’s Dawn reveals chemical energy source on Ceres appeared first on NASASpaceFlight.com.
detailed_news: Using data from NASA’s now-retired Dawn spacecraft, scientists have found that Ceres may have once had a lasting source of chemical energy. The Dawn data revealed evidence of molecules needed to fuel microbial metabolisms on Ceres. While the finding doesn’t confirm that microorganisms existed on Ceres long ago, it does support theories that the dwarf planet may haveonce been capable of supporting single-celled lifeforms. If Ceres ever hosted life, it would have been approximately 2.5 to 4 billion years ago. During that time, warm fluids would have filled Ceres’ subsurface water reservoirs, creating environments rich with nutrients and molecules needed for life. Many dwarf planets also lack satellites or parent planets, resulting in a lack of internal heating.

title: What’s Happening in Space Policy September 7-13, 2025
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week of September 7-13, 2025 and any insight we can offer about them. The House and Senate are in session […]
detailed_news: The House and Senate will work on the FY2026 NDAA this week. The House Appropriations Committee will hold the full-committee markup of the Commerce-Justice-Science bill that was postponed in July. Both the Senate and House committees would keep NASA roughly at its current $24.8 billion level. The American Astronautical Society’s annual Glenn Space Technology Symposium is tomorrow through Wednesday at Case Western Reserve University in Cleveland, Ohio. The U.S. Chamber of Commerce will hold its annual Global Aerospace Summit in Washington, DC Tuesday-Thursday. On the same three days, the NEXPLORE Conference will be taking place at Amazon HQ2 across the river in Arlington, VA. title: ESA deploys new fully European ground-based atomic clock
summary: As part of an effort coordinated by the European Space Agency (ESA), Safran has released the first ultra-precise active hydrogen maser technology, entirely developed and designed in Europe.
detailed_news: Safran has released the first ultra-precise active hydrogen maser technology, entirely developed and designed in Europe. Precise clocks are critical to ensure the reliable and sustainable functioning of the ground-based infrastructure. In August 2025, ESA deployed the All-European-Maser at one of its deep space ground stations, located in New Norcia, Australia. The European maser was supported by ESA’s General Support Technology Programme (GSTP) It will support two 35-meter-diameter deep space antennas: the existing NNO-1 antenna and the upcoming N NO-3 antenna, which will be inaugurated on 4 October 2025.

title: NASA Seeks Industry Input on Next Phase of Commercial Space Stations
summary: NASA is requesting feedback from American companies on the next phase of its commercial space stations strategy to ensure a seamless transition of activities in low Earth orbit from the International Space Station. The agency released a draft Phase 2 Announcement for Partnership Proposals (AFPP) Friday, asking for feedback from industry partners by 1 p.m. […]
detailed_news: NASA is seeking feedback from American companies on the next phase of its commercial space stations strategy. The agency released a draft Phase 2 Announcement for Partnership Proposals Friday, asking for feedback from industry partners by 1 p.m. EDT Friday, Sept. 12. In Phase 2, NASA intends to support industry’s design and demonstration of commercial stations.

title: NASA Announces CHAPEA Crew for Year-Long Mars Mission Simulation
summary: Four research volunteers will soon participate in NASA’s year-long simulation of a Mars mission inside a habitat at the agency’s Johnson Space Center in Houston. This mission will provide NASA with foundational data to inform human exploration of the Moon, Mars, and beyond. Ross Elder, Ellen Ellis, Matthew Montgomery, and James Spicer enter into the […]
detailed_news: Four research volunteers will soon participate in NASA’s year-long simulation of a Mars mission. The team will live and work like astronauts for 378 days, concluding their mission in 2026. This mission will provide NASA with foundational data to inform human exploration of the Moon, Mars, and beyond. Laura Marie is a commercial airline pilot specializing in flight safety. James Spicer is a technical director in the aerospace and defense industry. Emily Phillips is a captain and pilot in the United States Marine Corps. Matthew Montgomery works with technology startup companies to develop, commercialize, and scale their products.

title: Ten flights in, the Starship Program has had successes and failures
summary:
SpaceX has had a long journey through 10 flight tests of Starship. Teams have endured…
The post Ten flights in, the Starship Program has had successes and failures appeared first on NASASpaceFlight.com.
detailed_news: SpaceX has had a long journey through 10 flight tests of Starship. Teams have endured explosions and failures, but also achieved triumphs through amazing reentries, catches of Boosters, and even the reuse of a Booster. After 10 flights of Starship, the Program stands on the doorstep of a new generation of vehicles and possible ship reuse in 2026. SpaceX has completed four flights of its Falcon 9 rocket. The first flight, Flight 1, was a success with all 33 engines running for the entire ascent burn. The lessons learned from this flight paved the way for Ship 25 and Booster 9. Ship 25 nearly made it to second stage engine cutoff (SECO), but it was lost due to a fire in the aft section. Flight 5 would launch on Oct 13, 2024, and to this date, it is the most successful flight in the Starship program. This flight also involved an upgraded heat shield for Ship 30 to better survive reentry by introducing an ablative layer under the tiles. The next flight, SpaceX aimed to achieve the fastest turnaround so far with the launch pad and a new set of vehicles. The hope was that with Ship 33+, SpaceX would be able to get into orbit, perform the refueling demonstration, and catch a ship. SpaceX has completed 10 flights of its Block 2 Starship rocket. Flight 10 was the first flight to test the new heat shield design of Block 2. The final Block 2 flight is likely set to be sometime in October of 2025. Following Flight 11, SpaceX will transition to Block 3 of Starship.

title: NASA’s acting chief “angry” about talk that China will beat US back to the Moon
summary: "I can tell you what, I'll be damned if that is the story that we write."
detailed_news: NASA's interim administrator, Sean Duffy, said Thursday he has heard the recent talk about how some people are starting to believe that China will land humans on the Moon before NASA can. "I can tell you what, I'll be damned if that is the story that we write," he said. Duffy's remarks followed a Congressional hearing on Wednesday during which former Congressman Jim Bridenstine said China had pulled ahead of NASA and the United States. Duffy: "Sometimes we can let safety be the enemy of making progress" "We can’t side on the side of doing nothing because we are too afraid of taking risk," he says. "We have to be able to take some leaps," he adds.

title: Rocket Report: Neutron’s pad opens for business; SpaceX gets Falcon 9 green light
summary: "Nobody’s waving the white flag here until the last hour of the last day."
detailed_news: Israel successfully launches Ofek 19 satellite from Palmachim Airbase. MaiaSpace completes tank tests. Reaction Dynamics invests in Nova Scotia launch site. Orienspace secures B+ round funding as it moves towards a test flight, Space News reports."Nobody’s waving the white flag here until the last hour of the last day" Orienspace secured funding of between $27 million and $124 million. The capital will be used mainly for the follow-up development and mass production of the Gravity-2 medium-lift liquid launch vehicle. Rocket Lab sees Neutron as a contender to ease the bottleneck in demand from both commercial and military customers for a ride to space. SpaceX founder Elon Musk says heat shield tiles almost entirely stayed attached. SpaceX wants to be able to refly Starships within 24 hours. It takes more than 200 tanker trucks traveling from distant refineries to deliver all of the methane, liquid oxygen, and liquid nitrogen for a Starship launch. You don't need to know everything, only what’s important. After all, you don’t need to be a genius to know how to get things done. You just need to do what you need to get the job done. That's all that's important.

title: Hubble Spies Galaxy with Lots to See
summary: While it may appear as just another spiral galaxy among billions in the universe, this image from the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope reveals a galaxy with plenty to study. The galaxy, NGC 7456, is located over 51 million light-years away in the constellation Grus (the Crane). This Hubble image reveals fine detail in the galaxy’s […]
detailed_news: The galaxy, NGC 7456, is located over 51 million light-years away in the constellation Grus (the Crane) This Hubble image reveals fine detail in the galaxy’s patchy spiral arms, followed by clumps of dark, obscuring dust. Blossoms of glowing pink are rich reservoirs of gas where new stars are forming.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX aims for 500th Falcon booster landing amid sunrise Starlink mission
summary: The Starlink 10-57 mission is also SpaceX’s 80th launch this year carrying Starlink satellites to low Earth obit. It’s targeting liftoff from pad 39A at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center is scheduled for 7:29 a.m. EDT (1129 UTC).

title: Curiosity Blog, Sols 4641-4648: Thinking Outside and Inside the ‘Boxwork’
summary: Written by Ashley Stroupe, Mission Operations Engineer and Rover Planner at NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory Earth planning week: Aug. 25, 2025. This week Curiosity has been exploring the boxwork unit, investigating both the ridges and the hollows to better characterize them and understand how they may have formed. We’ve been doing lots of remote science, […]
detailed_news: This week Curiosity has been exploring the boxwork unit, investigating both the ridges and the hollows to better characterize them and understand how they may have formed. We’ve been doing lots of remote science, contact science, and driving in each plan. And after each drive, we also use AEGIS to do some autonomous target selection.

title: Project Kuiper scores first airline win as JetBlue picks LEO over GEO
summary:
Amazon’s Project Kuiper has clinched its first airline deal, partnering with JetBlue to bring LEO connectivity to about 75 aircraft from 2027 in another blow to legacy geostationary players.
